workflow.name: Automate Incident Management with PagerDuty, Port AI, Jira & Slack
workflow.description:
Complete incident workflow from detection through resolution to post-mortem, with full organizational context from Port's catalog. This template handles both incident triggered and resolved events from PagerDuty, automatically creating Jira tickets with context, notifying teams via Slack, calculating MTTR, and using Port AI Agents to schedule post-mortem meetings and create documentation.

## How it works
The n8n workflow orchestrates the following steps:

**On Incident Triggered:**
- PagerDuty webhook ‚Äî Receives incident events from PagerDuty via POST request.
- Event routing ‚Äî Routes to triggered or resolved flow based on event type.
- Port context enrichment ‚Äî Uses Port's n8n node to query your software catalog for service context, on-call engineers, recent deployments, runbooks, and past incidents.
- AI severity assessment ‚Äî OpenAI assesses severity based on Port context and recommends investigation actions.
- Escalation routing ‚Äî Critical incidents automatically escalate to leadership Slack channel.
- Jira ticket creation ‚Äî Creates incident ticket with full context, investigation checklist, and recommended actions.
- Team notification ‚Äî Notifies the team's Slack channel with incident details and resources.

**On Incident Resolved:**
- Port context extraction ‚Äî Gets post-incident context from Port including stakeholders and documentation spaces.
- MTTR calculation ‚Äî Calculates mean time to resolution from incident timestamps.
- Post-mortem generation ‚Äî AI generates a structured post-mortem template with timeline.
- Port AI Agent scheduling ‚Äî Triggers Port AI Agent to schedule post-mortem meeting, invite stakeholders, and create documentation.
- Resolution notification ‚Äî Notifies team with MTTR, post-mortem document link, and meeting details.
- Metrics logging ‚Äî Logs MTTR metrics back to Port for service reliability tracking.

## Setup
- [ ] Register for free on [Port.io](https://www.port.io)
- [ ] Configure Port with services, on-call schedules, and deployment history
- [ ] Set up Port AI agents for post-mortem scheduling
- [ ] Connect PagerDuty webhook for incident events
- [ ] Configure Jira project for incident tickets (use project key 'INC' or customize)
- [ ] Set up Slack channels for alerts (#incidents and #leadership-alerts)
- [ ] Add OpenAI credentials for severity assessment
- [ ] Test with a sample incident event
- [ ] You should be good to go!

## Prerequisites
- You have a Port account and have completed the onboarding process.
- Port's integrations are configured (GitHub, Jira, PagerDuty if available).
- You have a working n8n instance (Cloud or self-hosted) with Port's n8n custom node installed.
- PagerDuty account with webhook capabilities.
- Jira Cloud account with appropriate project permissions.
- Slack workspace with bot permissions to post messages.
- OpenAI API key for severity assessment and post-mortem generation.


‚ö†Ô∏è This template is intended for Self-Hosted instances only.

parameters.prompt:
=A PagerDuty incident has been triggered.

Incident Details:
- ID: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.id }}
- Title: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.title }}
- Service: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.service.name }}
- Urgency: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.urgency }}
- Created At: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.created_at }}

Query the Port catalog for comprehensive context about this incident.

Retrieve:
1. Affected service details (tier, criticality, SLA)
2. Service owners and current on-call engineers
3. Recent deployments (last 48 hours)
4. Related pull requests or configuration changes
5. Dependencies and upstream/downstream services
6. Known vulnerabilities or ongoing issues
7. Runbook URLs and monitoring dashboards
8. Past similar incidents and resolution patterns
9. Team's Slack channel

Output as JSON:
{
  "service_name": "",
  "service_tier": "tier1|tier2|tier3",
  "sla_minutes": 0,
  "owners": [],
  "on_call_engineers": [],
  "slack_channel": "",
  "recent_deployments": [],
  "recent_changes": [],
  "dependencies": [],
  "runbook_url": "",
  "dashboard_url": "",
  "past_incidents_summary": "",
  "known_issues": [],
  "jira_project_key": ""
}

Rules:
- Only include data that exists in Port
- Use empty strings/arrays if not found

messages.content:
=You are an incident management expert. Assess this incident and determine if immediate escalation is needed.

Incident:
- Title: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.title }}
- Service: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.service.name }}
- Urgency: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.urgency }}

Context from Port:
{{ $json.result.message }}

Consider:
1. Is this a production service?
2. Were there recent deployments that could be related?
3. Are there known issues affecting this service?
4. What is the SLA requirement?

Provide your response as JSON:
{
  "severity_assessment": "critical|high|medium|low",
  "needs_escalation": true or false,
  "escalation_reason": "reason if needs_escalation is true",
  "likely_cause": "brief assessment of likely cause",
  "recommended_actions": ["action 1", "action 2", "action 3"],
  "investigation_checklist": ["check 1", "check 2", "check 3"]
}

Return ONLY the JSON object.

parameters.prompt:
=A PagerDuty incident has been resolved.

Incident Details:
- ID: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.id }}
- Title: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.title }}
- Service: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.service.name }}
- Created At: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.created_at }}
- Resolved At: {{ $('On PagerDuty Incident').item.json.body.event.data.resolved_at || new Date().toISOString() }}

Query the Port catalog for post-incident context.

Retrieve:
1. Service details and owners
2. Team's Slack channel
3. Changes made during the incident window
4. Confluence/Notion space for post-mortems
5. Calendar integration details for scheduling

Calculate incident_duration_minutes from created_at to resolved_at.

Output as JSON:
{
  "service_name": "",
  "owners": [],
  "slack_channel": "",
  "confluence_space": "",
  "calendar_id": "",
  "incident_duration_minutes": 0,
  "changes_during_incident": [],
  "stakeholders_to_invite": []
}

Only include data that exists in Port.

parameters.content:
## Incident Lifecycle Management with Port

Complete incident workflow from detection through resolution to post-mortem, with full organizational context from Port's catalog.

### How it works

**On Incident Triggered:**
1. Receive PagerDuty webhook
2. Query Port for service context, on-call, recent changes
3. AI assesses severity and recommends actions
4. Route notifications based on severity
5. Create Jira ticket with context

**On Incident Resolved:**
1. Calculate MTTR
2. Generate post-mortem template
3. Port AI Agent schedules post-mortem meeting
4. Create post-mortem document
5. Notify team with resolution summary
6. Log MTTR metrics to Port

### Setup
- [ ] Register for free at [Port.io](https://www.port.io)
- [ ] Configure Port with services, on-call, and deployment history
- [ ] Set up Port AI agents for post-mortem scheduling
- [ ] Connect PagerDuty webhook for incident events
- [ ] Configure Jira project for incidents
- [ ] Set up Slack channels for alerts
- [ ] Add OpenAI credentials
- [ ] Test with a sample incident

## Incident Triggered Flow

Port context enrichment + AI severity assessment + intelligent routing + Jira creation

## Incident Resolved Flow

MTTR calculation + Post-mortem generation + Port AI Agent schedules meeting + Document creation + Metrics logging

## Port AI Agent

Schedules post-mortem meeting:
- Creates document
- Invites stakeholders
- Sets appropriate time
- Links to incident

user.name: Port IO
user.bio: Port.io provides an agentic developer platform designed to reduce engineering friction and accelerate delivery. With customizable software catalogs, automated workflows, and built-in governance, Port enables developers to self-serve while giving platform teams strong visibility and control. Companies use Port to improve productivity, enforce standards, and deliver more reliable software.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
